intro: Sphaerocephalus gaillardotii, commonly known as the African starfish or African starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped inflorescence, which consists of numerous small white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a spherical cluster. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or saline soils. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its resilience to coastal conditions. Sphaerocephalus gaillardotii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
